questions.text: In an exhumed body which of the following poisons can be detected in bones:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Arsenic Arsenic gets deposited preferentially in Bones, Hairs and Nails . Thus even if the body has been buried or burnt after death Arsenic can still be detected in the remnant bones. To detect chronic arsenic poisoning blood is not a good sample as all the minute amounts of arsenic introduced into the body for a long time has selectively deposited in the bones.

Highyeild:

EXHUMATION- Legalized / authorized digging out of an already buried body from the grave. Why ? Civil Reasons – For Identification For Insurance claims Criminal cases – Suspected homicide, suspected criminal abortion Authorization – Exhumation can only be ordered by judicial (or) executive magistrate Police cannot order for exhumation. Procedure : There is no time limit for exhumation in India Conducted by the Executive magistrate in the presence of Doctor and Exhumation has to be done only in day time. Whole process is to be As soon as the body is seen in the groove , in the same position, it is to be If the death is suspected to be poison, then we need to collect about 1 kg of soil.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, C and D. can not be detected in bones.

Extraedge:

Poison detected on Exhumation-PEA P hosphorous E ndrins A rsenic

Table:

#MANTRA E xecutive Magistrate Inquest needed in 3Es (CrPC 176): Dowry death ( E vil-inlaw ) Death due to police firing / E ncounter E xhumation Judicial magistrate inquest -Dealt under (CrPc 176 1 A): Conducted in 1.Custodial death/ disappearance 2.Custodial rape

questions.text: A witness comes to court for evidence recording. Witness is giving false evidence in court of law. This offense is punishable under which IPC?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

193 Perjury- the act of telling a lie in a c ourt of law is punishable under S. 193 IPC. Whoever intentionally gives false evidence in any of a judicial proceeding, or fabricates false evidence for the purpose of being used in any stage of a judicial proceeding, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years , and shall also be liable to fine ; and whoever intentionally gives or fabricates false evidence in any other case, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years , and shall also be liable to fine.

Highyeild:

PENAL PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO MEDICAL PRACTICE: I.P.C. S. 52 Nothing is said to be done in good faith which is done without due care and attention. S. 191 Giving false evidence. S. 192 Fabricating false evidence. S. 193 Punishment for false evidence (imprisonment up to seven years). S. 194 Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence (imprisonment up to ten years ). S. 195 Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence (imprisonment for life or imprisonment. ) S. 197 Issuing or signing false certificates ( imprisonment up to seven years ). S. 201 Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offenders ( imprisonment up to ten years ). S. 202 Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform ( imprisonment up to six months ). S. 203 Giving false information respecting an offence committed (imprisonment up to two years ). S. 204 Destruction of document to prevent its production as evidence (imprisonment up to two years). S. 269 Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life (imprisonment up to six months ). S. 270 Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life (imprisonment up to two years ). S. 284 Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substances .(imprisonment upto 6 months ).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.191 -Defines perjury Option B.192- Defines fabricating evidence Option D.197- Deals with issuing false certificate.

questions.text: In a dead body having, bloated face and tongue protruding out the following (shown in the picture) was noted. What is the probable cause of the finding seen in the picture?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Putrefaction The findings that can be seen in the picture are skin blebs and greenish discoloration of the body.These are post-mortem changes due to Putrefaction.

Highyeild:

Decomposition/Putrefaction - Putrefaction is the process of decay or rotting in a body or other organic matter Main cause: Clostridium welchii producing Stages: Color change: Earliest external sign: greenish discoloration of Right iliac fossa. Earliest internal sign: Green/Reddish/ Brown discoloration of vessel wall/Aorta. Marbling of veins: Irregular discolouration of network of veins Forensic importance: Marbling is suggestive of Time since death (TSD) of 36-48 hr Formation of gasses- Blisters all over the body. PM purge_-Blood stained froth from mouth and nostrils Honeycomb liver Skin, hair, nails, teeth slippage in 2,3,4,5 days respectively. Liquefaction of tissue By 5-10 days Tissues: greasy,black substance Casper dictum: Rate of decomposition in Air: Water: Earth =1:2:8 Last to decompose: Males-Prostate < bone (last) Females-Virgin uterus< bone(last)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Electric burn- will show current pearls, joule burns,Bone melt, keratitis. Option B.Crocodile burn- is seen in electrocution. Option C.Scalds-is seen on moist heat injury.

questions.text: The Onus of proof in civil negligence case against a doctor lies with:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Patient Onus of proof - liability to prove the allegation and it commonly lies on the party who is alleging the charges.In Civil negligence plaintiff is a patient while defender is Doctor. Thus the onus lies upon the patient. Patient has to prove the allegation s through evidence.

Highyeild:

Criteria Civil negligence Criminal negligence Damage Minor Major Action of patient Civil court or consumer court State vs doctor Complaint Patient vs doctor State vs doctor Action of court Pay compensation Imprisonment /fine/both Onus of proof On patient On doctor

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and C are incorrect. The onus of proof in civil negligence lies on the patient.

questions.text: Magnan’s symptoms are associated with which poisoning event?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cocaine Magnan's s ymptom is seen in people with cocaine addiction who experience Paraesthesia which feels like a constantly moving foreign body , such as fine sand or powder, under the skin . The sign is named after Valentin Magnan,This is also known cocaine bug as addicted person feel insect is crawling under the skin.

Highyeild:

COCAINE - Obtained from leaves of Erythroxylon Coca. Slang names : White lady, Coke, Cadillac, Snow Cigarettes with cocaine called crack Cocaine leaves contain < 2% of cocaine→ Treated with H2SO4 → Cocaine sulfate → Treated with HCl→ Cocaine Hydrochloride →Cocaine hydrochloride contains 90% of cocaine →Used for snorting and injections Cocaine hydrochloride again treated with baking soda → crack → smoke Most Common usage – snorting Actions Local Anesthetic Powerful CNS depressant – for a short time Rush followed by depression. Signs and symptoms Acute addiction: Stage of early stimulation- euphoria, dry mouth,tachycardia,numb mouth. Stage of advanced stimulation- hallucination, hyperthermia (cocaine fever), convulsions. Stage of depression- Muscle paralysis, coma, death. Treatment : Amyl Nitrate Chronic Addiction- Cocainism Cocainophagia Cocainomana Black discoloration of teeth & tongue Painless perforation of Nasal septum Magnum symptoms – also called cocaine bugs /formication/Tactile Hallucination → Bugs / Insects / Sand particles crawling beneath skin→ Scratching → Multiple scratch marks + →Bruxism → Grinding of teeth. Medico Legal Importance- Cocaine – 2nd most commonly used illicit drug. Applied on glans penis to increase duration of coitus. Prostitutes inject into vagina for local construction Cocaine + Heroine → I.V – speedball → smoke – moon rock

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,C and D. Cannabis, Opium and LSD- do not show Magnon’s symptoms.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Most commonly used drug which leads to drug dependence?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cannabis Addictions of drugs are as follows - Nicotine > Alcohol > Cannabis > Painkillers > Cocaine > Heroin > Benzodiazepines Most commonly used drug among the options is cannabis.

Highyeild:

CANNABIS- Called by – Pot, Weed, Grass, Mary Jane. Cigarettes containing cannabis – Reefer / Joint. Active principle – Tetrahydrocannabinol Typical burnt rope odor Preparations: Bhang : Drink / Beverage / Decoction / Cannabis tea 15% of active principle Mildest form Prepared from dried leaves and shoots Majoon : Sweet prepared from Bhang – Honey +Ghee Ganja : Prepared from flowers (top) of female plant Green Rustic powder – smell 15 – 25% of active principle Smoking: Chillum / Pipe Cigarette:Reefer / Joint Also referred to Marijuana/ Marihuana Charas / Hashish – Resin extract from stem 40% of active principle – most potent preparation Smoking 5.Hash oil → 70 – 90% of active principle Sinsemilla Signs and Symptoms [EEE] : Euphoria Emotional Instability Erotic feeling Chronic Poisoning- Amotivational syndrome Run Amok - Homicidal Impulse / Killing spree →Depression→HomicidalImpulse→Depression → Kills himself, Surrenders . Koro : Male – penis is retracted into abdomen Female – Breast is retracted into chest Medico Legal Importance- World’s most widely used Illicit drug Sadhus / Fakir Treatment : Specific Treatment : 100ml 50% Dextrose+100mg thiamine+2mg Naloxone Dependence : Only psychological dependence, No physiological dependence.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B, C and D. are Because, Most commonly used drug among the options is cannabis.

questions.text: In a rape incident on small child the hymen?

options.label: B
options.text: Rupture, because it is situated superficially

options.label: C
options.text: Don’t rupture because it is thick

options.label: D
options.text: Don’t rupture because it is situated deeply

questions.correct_answer: D. Don’t rupture because it is situated deeply
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Don’t rupture because it is situated deeply The hymen is a thin piece of mucosal tissue that surrounds or partially covers the external vaginal opening .In child the hymen is situated deeply and it is of mostly crescent shaped and due to gross difference in the sizes of the external genitalia of the small victim and the rape offender, often the male penis is not pushed deep into the vagina and thus the Hymen remains intact.

Highyeild:

sexual intercourse In child Adult virgin Deflorated woman Perineum Lacerated Lacerated in forceful penetration Injuries only in forceful penetration. Vulva Abrasion/contusion/laceration Abrasion/contusion Vagina Tender Bleeding Laceration of posterior vaginal wall Abrasion on cervix(In digital penetration) Tender Roomy Bleeding Laceration of posterior vaginal wall Abrasion on cervix(In digital penetration) Hymen Incomplete penetration- No tear. Complete penetration: Torn , Bleeds on touch. Incomplete penetration: may not tear. Complete penetration: Torn (at 5,6,7 o’clock), Bleeds on touch. No injuries

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and C. are incorrect.

Table:

#MANTRA POCSO act 2012 (Protection Of Children from Sexual Offences) Amended in 2019- It is a gender neutral law. Children- MALE/FEMALE<18 year. Not reporting abuse is an offence (sec 19,21). No time limit for reporting abuse. Maintaining confidentiality of the victim’s identity. (sec.23) The police officer while recording the statement of the child shall not be in Woman police officer not below the rank of sub-inspector. Special court: Additional district court. Trial should be completed in 1 year. In camera trial. The child shall not see accused in any proceedings. Sections 3,5,7,9,11,13-definitions. Sections 4,6,8,10,12,14- punishment. Classes of offence under POCSO act- Class of offence Includes Punishable under section Punishment Penetrative sexual assault Penetration/ Insertion/ Manipulation/ application into mouth/vagina/anus. section 4 10 year to life imprisonment Aggravated Penetrative sexual assault Penetrative sexual assault with Mentally ill child. OR someone in position of trust/authority OR Child become pregnant OR gang rape OR Multiple time sexual assault OR Child gets HIV. section 6 20 year to life imprisonment Sexual assault Physical contact with Sexual intent but NO Penetration/ Insertion/ Manipulation/ application Section 8 3 to 5 year imprisonment. Aggravated sexual assault Sexual assault with Mentally ill child. OR someone in position of trust/authority OR Child become pregnant OR gang rape OR Multiple time sexual assault OR Child gets HIV. Section 10 5 to 7 year imprisonment. Sexual harassment Sexual intent is present. Showing pornography/eve teasing/child body part exhibition /threatening by media Section 12 Imprisonment upto 3 year with fine Child pornography is banned. section 14 3 to 7 year imprisonment.

questions.text: The POCSO act defines a child as a person under the age of 18 years. However this definition is a purely biological one and does not take into account people who live with intellectual and psycho-social disability. As per POCSO act, a child was brought for age estimation. X ray wrist was taken. The age of this wrist joint is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

10 years Pisiform has appeared and seen in the X-ray which is suggestive of 9-12yr age. Union of shaft of 1 st metacarpal with its head occurs at 15 yr of age In the context of this question it has not fused. Thus the finding suggests that the age is < 15 years . So taking the criteria of pisiform bone and 1 st metatarsal shaft not fused with its base the best answer is 10 years.

Highyeild:

Following four criteria for X Ray wrist are used to determine the biological or chronological age of a child. 1. Appearance of lower end and upper end of ulna at the age of 6yr and 9yr respectively 2.Appearance of lower and upper end of radius at the age of 2yr and 5yr respectively 3.Fusion of Lower end ulna and radius at the age of 18 years and 19 years respectively. Appearance of carpal bones are as follows: Capitate 2 month Hamate 3 month Triquetral 3yr Lunate 4yr Scaphoid 4-5yr Trapezium 4-5yr Trapezoid 5-6yr Pisiform 9-12yr

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.4 years- will show only 4 carpal bones. Option B.7 years- will have only 7 carpal bones. Option D.13 days- will not show any carpal bones.

Extraedge:

Age No. of carpal bones present 1 yr 2 2 yr 2 3 yr 3 4 yr 4 5 yr 6 6 yr 7 9 yr 8

Table:

#MANTRA All the ossification centers around the elbow joint will fuse with their respective shafts by 16 – 17 years ,hence the best X-ray to determine the age of 16 – 17 years is elbow joint. As head of femur, lesser trochanter and greater trochanter fuse by 17 -18 years ,the best X-ray to determine the age of 17 -18 years is the hip joint. Lower end of femur, upper end of tibia and upper end of fibula fuses by 18 – 19 years .Best X-ray for 18 – 19 years is Knee joint. Upper end of femur, because iliac crest & ischial tuberosity fuses by 20 – 21 years .Best X-ray for 20 – 21 years is Hip joint.

questions.text: An investigation team reached a crime site where the team collects the trace evidences and send it to the forensic laboratory, where a forensic expert see “Yellow colour needle shape crystals” in microscopy. What is the test?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Barberios test Among the above given options only Barberios test shows Yellow color needle shape crystals.

Highyeild:

SEMINAL STAINS- Tests broadly divided into Chemical Tests: Acid Phosphatase Barberio’s Creatine Phosphokinase Florence Prostate specific antigen (PSA, P30) Microscopic Examination Chemical tests a.Acid phosphatase test - Secreted by prostate (prostatic epithelial cells) Activity of Acid phosphatase test in human semen is 500 – 1000 times greater than in any other body fluid. Normal acid phosphatase test activity in human semen is 340 – 360 Bodansky units per ml of semen. Concentration > 100 Bodansky units indicates that ejaculation occurred within 12 hours of examination Positive reactions are found upto 36 hrs after ejaculation in vaginal secretions. Acid phosphatase test – conclusive test in the absence of demonstrable sperm b.Barberio’s Test- Test / reaction depends on presence of spermine which comes from prostate Reaction gives a yellow, needle shaped, rhombic crystal of spermine picrate. c. Creatine Phosphokinase (CPK) Test - CPK – found both in spermatozoa and seminal ,plasma Normal seminal fluid contains , 385 -1400 units of CPK per ml Levels > 400 units are diagnostic of seminal stains The enzyme is stable and can be demonstrated in old stains of 6 months. d.Florence Test - Tests depend on the presence of choline in semen which comes from seminal vesicles. Choline is responsible for bluish – white fluorescence of seminal stains under UV light. Positive test gives dark brown, rhombic or needle shaped crystals of choline iodide, which resemble hemin crystals. This test is not specific for semen, as several substances of animal and vegetable origin give positive results. e. Prostate specific Antigen - PSA/ P30 - A glycoprotein produced by prostatic epithelial cells Detection of PSA – reliable indicator of semen Useful indicator in Azoospermia Microscopic Examination : The only absolute proof of semen is the microscope detection of at least one unbroken sperm. Complete sperms are seen upto 26 hrs in vagina, in the living, after ejaculation. After 26 hrs, they separate into head and tail. Similarly, after death complete sperms may be found upto 2 days in vagina and upto one week in the cervix & uterus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Teichmann's test -will show brown,rhombic crystal. Option C.Takayama test -will show Pink, feathery appearance. Option D.Florence test- will show Brown, Rhombic crystal ,bigger compared to Teichmann’s test.

Extraedge:

Red stain: Luminol spray test (high sensitivity)- test of choice Spectroscopy (high specificity)- Most reliable test White stain: UV light Gold standard: presence of intact sperm under microscope (stain-christmas tree). Azoospermia-raised levels of Prostate specific antigen (P 30) + acid phosphatase.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Tattoo marks are not visible during autopsy as confirmed by relatives, they alleges that it has been removed artificially by someone. Where tattooing or pigment used in the tattooing can be checked next during autopsy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Regional Lymph nodes Tattoo marks are designs made by multiple small puncture wounds made through the dermis layer with needles or similar penetrating tools dipped in coloring agents (dye) . which are drained into nearby lymph nodes via subcutaneous lymphatics.

Highyeild:

Dye used- Vermillion, cinnabar – disappear after minimum 10 years Black pigments (Indian ink) – permanent To reveal latent tattoo marks High contrast photography UV lamp or infra-red photography Computer image enhancement If Tattoo marked is absolutely invisible or removed artificially , pigment used to produce then may be detected in nearby lymph nodes by histological examination .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and C. are incorrect.

questions.text: A patient name Ramprashad came to psychiatric Hospital with some neurotic symptoms, On voluntary admission the maximum number of days a person can be
questions.explanation:
Solution:

30 days On voluntary admission the maximum number of days a person can be admitted as per mental health care act is 30 days.

Highyeild:

On voluntary admission of patient, Doctor has 10 days for making primary diagnosis, The certification will not be done by single examination. At Least 3 different examinations, on 3 different days on 3 different hours of the day, should be done for If Doctor wants some more time to make diagnosis he has to take permission from magistrate after approval Doctor gets 10 more days for diagnosis, if still doctor could not make diagnosis, he can get 10 more final days from magistrate . In this way the patient can be admitted for a maximum of 30 days in Hospital.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B,C and D. are incorrect.
